subject: Re: Getting @Ignore reported?
msgSnippet: Thanks for the reply. I also found the Ant issue after a quick google. I guess I was more interested on how Ant is extracting the information out of JUnit. I
messageBody:
Thanks for the reply. I also found the Ant issue after a quick google.

I guess I was more interested on how Ant is extracting the information
out of JUnit. I was hoping to avoid creating my own runner/formatter
to directly run and monitor the JUnit executions (just to get this
info). Is there any way, short of that, to get JUnit to "report" which
tests were ignored and why?

FYI, I've built a small utility class that grovels over the test
classes/methods looking for "@Ignore" annotations and spits out the
desired info already. It just seems like this functionality should be
built-in already.

Bob

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "yme0987654321" <yme0987654321@...> wrote:
>
> This is a known issue in Ant:
>
> https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=43969
>
